metadata.title: CVE-2012-2321 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The loopback plug-in in ConnMan before 0.85 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the (1) host name or(2) domain name in a DHCP reply.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.15-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15-0ubuntu3').
